column4: Unable to print to CUPS server printer from Open Office, printer not shown as an option, any help would be appreciated.
everning.  Can anyone help with inability to print to cups server from open office?
I connect fine and set my default printer but open office doesn't see the cups networked printer
go under System > Administration > Printing
I did this, even printed a test page, but printer does not show up under open office
hm..
the samba ones do show, but not the non local cups ones
Can anyone help me figure out what it wrong with this command, I want to see if this is a work around
ssh -L 631:localhost:631 vincent@abaddon
ssh -NL 631:localhost:631 vincent@abaddon; Could not request local forwarding
no name server.  hosts.conf is manually set.  192.168.55.152 abaddon abaddon.domain so it resolves fine
ssh -L 631:localhost:631 me@abaddon works but I don't see printers under system --> admin --> printers when I connect to localhost
bad local specificiation 'localhost:631'  I'm confident the format is local_port:local_ip:remote_port user_name@remote_ip
can somebody help me with the drivers for "Epson Stylus Photo R200"? I don't find any.
http://staff.washington.edu/corey/fw/ssh-port-forwarding.html ok, I did this ugh..

ok ssh -L 632:localhost:631 me@remote does work and I can connect, but open office is only looking at 631 on localhost :(  the cups server on localhost is conflicting with the attempted capture and forwarding on 631
theory confirmed.  sudo pkill cups; sudo ssh -L 631:localhost:631 me@remote and now open office see the printer :(

i plugged my printer and everything was automatically detected, then, after reinstalling cups, i plug it and i get to choose the drivers manually, which do not exist. is there some package i need to install?
hp printer?
epson stylus photo r200 (there are only drivers for photo 750, but there used to be for my printer.
yeah, I intentionally bought HP this time.  http://www.sourceforge.net/projects/hplip as hp maintains a commerical drive for linux.  Sorry, can't help with the epson
its fixed now, I just had to install the cups-drivers-guttenprint or something like that
